intro: Glyphosperma palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. It has slender, erect stems and small, pinnately compound leaves. Glyphosperma palmeri is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
